verbose_text: In addition, Krzyminska et al., reported that hospital isolated strains of S. marcescens produce toxins that contribute to its virulence and are essentials for the bacteria to adhere and invade to epithelial cells and induce hemolysis, cytotoxicity, and apoptosis of human epithelial cells and macrophages.
evidence: al., reported that hospital-isolated strains of S. marcescens produce toxins that contribute to its virulence and are essentials for the bacteria to adhere and invade to epithelial cells and induce hemolysis, cytotoxicity, and apoptosis
